subsc: Ports, waterways and shipping,Roads and highways,Sub-national government administration
trustfund:
TF036251-BENIN - PRIORITY REFORMS TO THE
            TSIP PHASE II,TF034818-BENIN - TRANSPORT SECTOR
            INVESTMENT PROGRAM,TF023037-PHRD-TRANSPORT SECTOR PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
The Transport Sector Investment Program
            Project  will rehabilitate Benin's main road network
            and set the basis for long term maintenance.  In rural
            areas, the main environmental impacts and accompanying
            mitigation measures will be:  a) laterite quarries, restored
            by leveling the grounds, spreading back organic soil and
            restoring vegetative cover or transformed into water
            reservoirs;  b) wetland degradation, impacted by imbalance
            to fragile ecosystems, loss of agricultural land use, and
            water body eutrophication, mitigated by improved drainage
            infrastructure resulting in the restoration of the original
            water transfers;  c) road drainage leading to accelerated
            formation of gullies and erosion will not have a great
            impact, but can be mitigated by improving downstream road
            drainage systems;  d) atmospheric pollution is negligible
            compared to other sources of air pollution, dust will be
            controlled by frequent watering of construction sites; and
            e) destruction of human habitat, mitigated by compensation
            measures.  There will be no population displacement due to
            the project.  Urban environmental impacts are similar with
            the addition of the risk of flooding which will be helped by
            improved water drainage situation in urban areas.
